instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight
threads.message: i checked every fuse i could see. but i have no backlight, from the diag i did on it, it looks like i dont have the keyboard or lcd backlight. so im looking for f7700 any idea where that is on this board? or where to look. the customer said he spilled some water on this but i see no signs of waterdamage anywhere, not even the indicator being red.

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight
threads.message: Check SMC_LID first! No diagram posted so you must use last year's and guess.Also what voltage is present on pin 1 of LCD connector when screen should be on? 0v, 12.6v, 19v, or 50v?

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight
threads.message: 5v on pin one, which one is last years? sorry i only know them by the 820-xxxx currently, and that also rules out my fuse being blown..

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight
threads.message: anyone know which one is last years

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight
threads.message: You are probably measuring pin 40. 5V on pin 1 makes no sense. Look at 00138 diagram, need to know voltage on PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight
threads.message: unless im compleatly reading the diagram wrong pin isnt pin 13, 16, 19, 22, 25-27, 31-41 all connected to ground. and should read 0.

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight
threads.message:
ok that is so confusing, the schematic shows 40 pins. yet there is only 30. sorry about that. makes way more since once i noticed it didnt match up
1    0
2    0
3    5
4    4.98
5    3.33
6    3.03
7    3.03
8    0.29
9    0
10    1.66
11-27    0
28    5.01
29    5.01
30    5.02

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight
threads.message:
Need to know if the fuse is good first. It will be in the backlight IC area, not hard to find.

Also the the backlight IC needs to "talk" to the LCD for it to turn on, make sure you have a known good test LCD for a 2015/16 machine. Other year LCDs will not work.

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight
threads.message: i know the lcd works as i do have picture. im having a hard time finding the backlight ic area. is there a number on the chip i can look for?

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight
threads.message: do you know a 15" retina model number. as stated above i only know boards as 820-XXXX

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight
threads.message: At this point you need a known good LCD for testing, only 2015/16 models will work, nothing else.
